pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [ff47b6d377](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15714/commits/ff47b6d377b0fe7d4877d8744be79cfe7ed0bb58)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.
I would like to hear @jsm28 's opinion on these changes.

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10507541276/job/29109519404)
Can you please merge master? Maybe that will make CI happy, or tell us why it is unhappy.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10508523024/job/29112602411)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10508523024/job/29112601541)
I don't have any comments on these changes.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Looks good, thanks!

maintainer merge
I don't have any comments on these changes.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
I personally prefer the `gcongr; norm_cast` version.
Only here, or everywhere?

Is there generally any preference in imo files to use tactic- or term-mode?

Maybe lets keep

```
... := by gcongr; norm_cast
```

in that case?
Undo this change, or all changes to terms in `calc` ?

I would prefer to revert all of them. `gcongr` is a very natural atomic step in my opinion. I think we should showcase it.
But my opinion isn't very strong.
All right, I will revert them all.
Is there a reason for moving this to the top? I think it also make sense to have it really close to the main result at the bottom.

I thought it might be better to readers to first see what we are proving and then start building lemmas towards it. If you want to keep it at the end, ok, but don't you want to inline it into the theorem?

I somewhat had the same question but deemed it not important. Lets go with Johan's suggestion in that case and leave it where it was.

Or what do other IMO files do?
If you don't want it on the top, it would better be inlined, right?
Maybe this is a nice use case for `recall`. So that you can recall both the `Condition` and `solutionSet` just before the final result.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: polishing the IMO solution 2024Q1
